title: charset=utf-8 added to Content-Type even if set manually in HTTP Response node
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?
Node-red appends charset=utf-8 to the Content-Type header in the HTTP Response node by default. If a custom header is set, it still adds charset=utf-8 no matter what the Content-Type that is set.

### What happens?
charset=utf-8 is appended to the content-type

### What do you expect to happen?
I expect that the exact header I manually set to be returned with the response and not messed with. This affects endpoints being used with services that are very picky with the Content-Type (eg. Twilio)

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ ] Node-RED version: 1.2.2

title: Unexpected UnhandledPromiseRejection during runtime
body:
Hi,
due to the last modifications in NodeJs version 15 (https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v15.0.0/#throw-on-unhandled-rejections-33021, https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/33021) now the default mode for unhandledRejection is changed to throw (from warn).

This sometimes causes some unexpected crash of Node-Red.

A temporary fix could be set an option to **--unhandled-rejections=warn** or use a version of NodeJs before 15.

title: context information pane messes up objects
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?
* use filesystem to store context data (maybe this is not necessary)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24778060/103612752-61e95d00-4f25-11eb-9be9-6961d13dcec0.png)

* use a change-node to store an object in flow context
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24778060/103612929-c5738a80-4f25-11eb-8081-58afd3abc457.png)

* use a change-node to assign this object to a payload.property
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24778060/103612808-847b7600-4f25-11eb-823b-90bbbccb66f4.png)

* use a change-node to add more properties to the payload.property
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24778060/103612819-8cd3b100-4f25-11eb-8f6d-de47465059ec.png)

### What happens?
* changes applied to payload.property are reflected as part of the context data object in the context information pane (=> this is not nice, but can be dealt with)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24778060/103612866-9f4dea80-4f25-11eb-89a2-1d6945b733d8.png)

* changes are alos applied to further references when accessing context data again from flow (=> This is actualy no wanted behaviour)

* this is not applied to storage of context data
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24778060/103612873-a2e17180-4f25-11eb-8fff-445c5586fbf5.png)

### What do you expect to happen?
* Assigning an object to an payload property should create a new and independant copy of object. Changes applliued here should not be seen in origin object.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: 1.2.5 (offical Docker Image)
- [x] Node.js version: (offical Docker Image)
- [x] npm version: (offical Docker Image)
- [x] Platform/OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3 / Docker 18.06.0-ce
- [x] Browser: Chrome 87.0.4280.88

title: missing i18n of action list (\editor-client\src\js\ui\actionList.js)
body:
The Action List is currently build in a generic way by JS in actionList.js, line 171+.
So it's not possible to do the i18n for the Action List.
The actionList.js is also missing in the design note: https://github.com/node-red/node-red/wiki/Design%3A-i18n
The generation of the Action List shall use a locales json table.

- [x] Node-RED version: V1.2.6
- [ ] Node.js version:
- [ ] npm version:
- [ ] Platform/OS:
- [ ] Browser:

title: Crash & quit while handling exception with undefine msg.error
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?
a) define flow with 3 nodes, http-in, delay 5-10s, http-out
b) client with 3s timeout request the flow
c) Server crashed and quit, log: TypeError: Cannot read property 'hasOwnProperty' of undefined
 at Flow.handleError (/usr/src/node-red/node_modules/@node-red/runtime/lib/flows/Flow.js:474:27)
 at HTTPOut.Node.error (/usr/src/node-red/node_modules/@node-red/runtime/lib/nodes/Node.js:523:30)

 at hooks.trigger (/usr/src/node-red/node_modules/@node-red/runtime/lib/nodes/Node.js:209:26)
 at Object.trigger (/usr/src/node-red/node_modules/@node-red/runtime/lib/hooks.js:113:9)
 at HTTPOut.Node._emitInput (/usr/src/node-red/node_modules/@node-red/runtime/lib/nodes/Node.js:195:11)

title: TypedInput: Cannot read property 'export' of undefined
body:
Hey guys,

Have spend some time tracking an annoying error, and would be nice if this could be fixed (to make sure other developers don't loose time figuring out what they have done wrong).

I have not created a PR for this issue, because I'm not sure which is the preferred way to solve it...

Thanks!
Bart

### What are the steps to reproduce?
Pass a `default` type to a TypedInput, which is not available in the array of allowed `types`:

In the following example my types only contain a (custom) *"enum"* type, but I specify incorrectly the default type "str" (which is not available in this TypedInput):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14224149/98459496-a06bd100-219b-11eb-990a-4269016ad31e.png)

### What happens?

1. When you try to get the type of the TypedInput:

   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14224149/98459584-93031680-219c-11eb-86df-2dbb7aa06125.png)

   It correctly returns a null:

   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14224149/98459552-3e5f9b80-219c-11eb-884f-d8311e0c1d21.png)

2. However when to try to get the value of the TypedInput:

   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14224149/98459609-bd54d400-219c-11eb-833a-30bc4bc7483e.png)

   Then throws an exception:

   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14224149/98459678-52f06380-219d-11eb-8a0c-9eaa936654b0.png)

### What do you expect to happen?

I expect that the TypedInput handles this better, and gives us some more user-friendly feedback.  But not sure how:
1. Should it return undefined as value?
2. Should it throw an exception when you specify a default type that is not in the allowed types?
3. Others?

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: 1.2.2
- [x] Node.js version: 12.19.0
- [x] npm version: 6.14.8
- [x] Platform/OS: Windows 10
- [x] Browser: Chrome

title: Filtering log does not work for subflows
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?
The flow below has three `inject` nodes. The first two are linked to `debug` nodes, and the third is linked to a subflow which only contains a `debug` mode. Deploy and click on each of the three `inject` nodes and you will see messages 1, 2 and 3. Then filter the log to only show the output from the first `debug`. 
```
[{"id":"f8a77096.30251","type":"subflow","name":"Subflow 3","info":"","in":[{"x":40,"y":80,"wires":[{"id":"8dca8e3d.a0788"}]}],"out":[]},{"id":"8dca8e3d.a0788","type":"debug","z":"f8a77096.30251","name":"","active":true,"tosidebar":true,"console":false,"tostatus":false,"complete":"false","statusVal":"","statusType":"auto","x":190,"y":80,"wires":[]},{"id":"cd09e402.1a3358","type":"inject","z":"757bd7fd.b41a48","name":"","props":[{"p":"payload"},{"p":"topic","vt":"str"}],"repeat":"","crontab":"","once":false,"onceDelay":0.1,"topic":"","payload":"Message 1","payloadType":"str","x":160,"y":100,"wires":[["512d4c2.5421eb4"]]},{"id":"512d4c2.5421eb4","type":"debug","z":"757bd7fd.b41a48","name":"","active":true,"tosidebar":true,"console":false,"tostatus":false,"complete":"false","statusVal":"","statusType":"auto","x":350,"y":100,"wires":[]},{"id":"882ea6ee.733f68","type":"inject","z":"757bd7fd.b41a48","name":"","props":[{"p":"payload"},{"p":"topic","vt":"str"}],"repeat":"","crontab":"","once":false,"onceDelay":0.1,"topic":"","payload":"Message 2","payloadType":"str","x":160,"y":180,"wires":[["e761fe52.b58f7"]]},{"id":"e761fe52.b58f7","type":"debug","z":"757bd7fd.b41a48","name":"","active":true,"tosidebar":true,"console":false,"tostatus":false,"complete":"false","statusVal":"","statusType":"auto","x":350,"y":180,"wires":[]},{"id":"ab4f3ba5.42a2d8","type":"inject","z":"757bd7fd.b41a48","name":"","props":[{"p":"payload"},{"p":"topic","vt":"str"}],"repeat":"","crontab":"","once":false,"onceDelay":0.1,"topic":"","payload":"Message 3","payloadType":"str","x":160,"y":260,"wires":[["7c016ef1.e08fc"]]},{"id":"7c016ef1.e08fc","type":"subflow:f8a77096.30251","z":"757bd7fd.b41a48","x":340,"y":260,"wires":[]}]
```
### What happens?
When you filter to only show one `debug` source, it still includes the message from the subflow. In fact if you filter to show nothing (ie. "selectd nodes" and untick everything), it still shows the messages from the subflow. There is no way to filter on a node in this tab without the subflow messages also being displayed.

Note that filtering on "current flow" does work - if you duplicate the flow above onto another tab, you can control the visibility of the messages from the `debug` nodes within each subflow, but only at the "current flow" level.

### What do you expect to happen?
Messages from the subflow should not display unless they are included in the filter. Ideally each `debug` node would show multiple times in the "selected nodes" list - once for each `debug` in the definition of the subflow, and then once for each invocation of the subflow. However, this might be tricky for subflows within subflows.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ ] Node-RED version: 1.2.2
- [ ] Node.js version: v10.22.1
- [ ] npm version: 6.14.4
- [ ] Platform/OS: Ubuntu 18.04
- [ ] Browser: Chrome

title: Cannot join multiple msg properties using the (core) join node
body:
# Cannot join multiple msg properties using the (core) join node
## The "reduce sequence" mode in Join node assigns value only to msg.payload; i.e. 
- To use split node only a single msg property is required to split the node, which is more often than not the payload itself. Other properties of the msg are copied into all new msgs. This is fine and **not an issue**
- To join multiple parts (lets call them child msgs) of an *original* msg (lets call them parent msg), the join node "joins" the payload or any other property when 'manual' node is selected. The **issue** arises when child msgs contain more than one property to be "joined". I was of the view that it can be done using the 'reduce sequence' mode, however I realized that the 'reduce sequence' mode assigns the final value to msg.payload 
(Probably this line in the code base: https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/0ecd9673b84435f645bb45984e5237b0c3572017/packages/node_modules/%40node-red/nodes/core/sequence/17-split.js#L284). 
**Thus, in the current state of affairs, we cannot "join" multiple properties while using the join node.**

### What are the steps to reproduce?
Run the following flow:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22973248/97279996-c639d180-188f-11eb-9a82-d0fe6379e4ee.png)

```
[{"id":"c73b49fa.c381f8","type":"split","z":"9e357fb1.f5191","name":"","splt":"\\n","spltType":"str","arraySplt":1,"arraySpltType":"len","stream":false,"addname":"","x":500,"y":360,"wires":[["5acc1cd3.5a7f44","4adb9cc4.001254"]]},{"id":"4adb9cc4.001254","type":"change","z":"9e357fb1.f5191","name":"","rules":[{"t":"set","p":"amount","pt":"msg","to":"$millis()","tot":"jsonata"}],"action":"","property":"","from":"","to":"","reg":false,"x":690,"y":360,"wires":[["d68d9cfc.7da0c","2f39cffd.c6088"]]},{"id":"66557073.501e4","type":"inject","z":"9e357fb1.f5191","name":"","props":[{"p":"payload"}],"repeat":"","crontab":"","once":false,"onceDelay":0.1,"topic":"","payload":"[\"a\", \"b\"]","payloadType":"json","x":300,"y":360,"wires":[["c73b49fa.c381f8","8be41a7b.a805b8"]]},{"id":"2f39cffd.c6088","type":"join","z":"9e357fb1.f5191","name":"","mode":"reduce","build":"string","property":"payload","propertyType":"msg","key":"topic","joiner":"\\n","joinerType":"str","accumulate":false,"timeout":"","count":"","reduceRight":false,"reduceExp":"($step1 := \t   $ ~> | $ | {\t       \"payload\": $append($A.payload, payload),\t       \"amount\": $A.amount + amount\t}, [\"parts\"]|\t)\t","reduceInit":"{\"payload\":[], \"amount\": 0}","reduceInitType":"json","reduceFixup":"$A","x":890,"y":360,"wires":[["37cf4fcd.80ee6"]]},{"id":"37cf4fcd.80ee6","type":"debug","z":"9e357fb1.f5191","name":"","active":true,"tosidebar":true,"console":false,"tostatus":false,"complete":"true","targetType":"full","statusVal":"","statusType":"auto","x":975,"y":420,"wires":[],"l":false}]
```

### What happens?
The output of the above flow (using debug node) is 
```
// msg obj = 
{
  "payload": {
    "payload": [
      "a",
      "b"
    ],
    "_msgid": "5156fb62.3b85f4",
    "amount": 3207579255663
  },
  "_msgid": "46f5a6bd.8fec08"
}
```
the **issue** is that our JSONata is assigned to msg.payload instead of the msg

### What do you expect to happen?
```
// msg obj = 
{
  
    "payload": [
      "a",
      "b"
    ],
    "_msgid": "5156fb62.3b85f4",
    "amount": 3207579255663
}
```

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ ] Node-RED version: 1.1.0
- [ ] Node.js version: 14.2.0
- [ ] npm version: N/A
- [ ] Platform/OS: N/A
- [ ] Browser: N/A

## Some background (just one of the use cases we have)
We build HTTP based microservices using NR, so everything is invoked using HTTP in node. Then some logic runs e.g. fetching all files from a remote server. Each file then needs to be transformed and while transforming, we would add some metadata to the msg object (like number of rows processed, status, time-taken etc.) At the end of processing these file, we would join the msgs that correspond to the one HTTP request and then serve the data and combined metadata using the HTTP response node

## Edit 1: Current workaround to solve the issue
> the flow.json posted under "What are the steps to reproduce?" above does not work with multiple split and join nodes combination. Use the below flow instead
1. Use split as is
2. Use join node along with function node (one can use change node in place of function)

title: localFileSystem data cleared
Having thousands of files in project folder makes the deployment super slow
body:
This happens when using node-red with a project setup. We are saving pictures to the project folder (see [this post on the forum](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/is-it-possible-to-have-a-projects-folder-outside-of-node-red/31130/) for a bit more context surrounding the why the project directory is used).

The bug was first reported [here](https://github.com/PlanktonPlanet/PlanktonScope/issues/55).

### What are the steps to reproduce? 
Create a lot of files inside directories nested in the project located in `.node-red` directory.

Try to redeploy a flow, even a simple one with only two nodes.

### What happens?
Experience the dreaded "A webpage is slowing down your browser" message and wait for the editor to unlock.

### What do you expect to happen?
Immediate deploy and editor immediately available. To be fair, the deploy seems to be quite fast. It's just that the editor locks down afterwards for a minute or two (depending on the file number).

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version:  v1.1.3 
- [x] Node.js version: v12.18.4
- [x] npm version: 6.14.6
- [x] Platform/OS: Raspberry Pi 4 4Gb, Raspberry OS
- [x] Browser: Firefox

title: Inconsistence in node-red's new flow admin API
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?

When one has a flow and uses the UI to export and import the flow, the system automagically parses the ids and changes them so they don't duplicate.
The same behavior should occur to the admin API.

### What happens?

If we try to get the flow by id and try to import it again the node-red complains that children node ids already exists.

### What do you expect to happen?

The expected behavior is that the API does the same as the UI because this is very useful for flow automation and it should be compatible with user interface.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: all
- [x] Node.js version: all
- [x] npm version: all
- [x] Platform/OS: all
- [x] Browser: all

At least if you consider that this may break someone that already made use of this bug, expose another API or an optional parameter for us to have this behavior the same as the editor's UI.

title: UNDO does not resize nodes in the flow properly if the label length changes as a result of the UNDO
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?
- custom node with label that reflects some internal state, for example `label: function() { return this.state; }` where this.state is being edited.
- save your changes after editing the state - the node is properly sized in the flow showing the new label
- edit the node again and change the length of the state string, for example to something shorter, save - all fine, resized
- UNDO

### What happens?
The node's state is restored to a longer string and the label reflects that but the node itself is not properly resized on the flow so it no longer fits the label (or is too wide if the label shortened with the undo)

### What do you expect to happen?
Node's size should be recalculated after an UNDO that affected the node, in case its label has changed in size.
Possibly, also check if there are any other nodes affected by an UNDO (for example my custom node's state is shown as label on other linked nodes and they're not only using wrong size after an UNDO but their label is not refreshed until I click on it).

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ ] Node-RED version: **1.1.1**
- [ ] Node.js version: **9.7.1**
- [ ] npm version: **5.6.0**
- [ ] Platform/OS: **Windows 10 x64**
- [ ] Browser: Chrome **83.0.4103.116**

title: TypeError: Class constructor CoreDocumentArray cannot be invoked without 'new'
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?
Using a function node to query mongodb with mongoose module.
And node.send() to return the Result return by the mongoose find function.
```
async function find_dev () {
    let Devices = global.get("Devices_Model" )
    msg.payload  = await Devices.find({ deviceID: '12345678 })
    
    node.send(msg)
}

await find_dev()
```

### What happens?
It seem that when I try to send the mongoose find function result with `node.send(msg)` i will get the following error message:
`TypeError: Class constructor CoreDocumentArray cannot be invoked without 'new'`

So I try disabling the 1st message cloning function with `node.send(msg, false)`, the message get sent without an issue.
But when I connect a second debug node at the end point, i will get the same error again since the 2nd message trigger the message cloning function.

### What do you expect to happen?
This issue seem to appear after I upgraded from 1.0.0 to 1.1.1.
I have verified it by reverting back to 1.0.0, it just works.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ 1.1.1] Node-RED version:
- [v12.18.2] Node.js version:
- [6.14.6] npm version:
- [KDE Neon & Ubuntu] Platform/OS:
- [Google Chrome Version 83.0.4103.116 (Official Build) (64-bit)] Browser:

title: node.warn(), debug nodes and Debug panel do not support arrays with additional properties
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?
Deploy the following flow
`
[
    {
        "id": "620e17cb.b82408",
        "type": "inject",
        "z": "c4be9dd8.3b604",
        "name": "",
        "props": [
            {
                "p": "payload"
            },
            {
                "p": "topic",
                "vt": "str"
            }
        ],
        "repeat": "",
        "crontab": "",
        "once": false,
        "onceDelay": 0.1,
        "topic": "",
        "payload": "",
        "payloadType": "date",
        "x": 110,
        "y": 80,
        "wires": [
            [
                "c3253e14.637de"
            ]
        ]
    },
    {
        "id": "c3253e14.637de",
        "type": "function",
        "z": "c4be9dd8.3b604",
        "name": "",
        "func": "const regex1 = RegExp('(?<foo>foo*)', 'g');\nconst str1 = 'table football, foosball';\nlet array1;\n\nwhile ((array1 = regex1.exec(str1)) !== null) {\n  console.dir(array1);\n  node.warn(array1);\n}\n\nlet a = [\"item 0\", \"item 1\", 2];\n\na[\"myProperty\"] = {\"prop 0\" : \"prop 0\", \"prop 1\": \"prop 1\"};\n\nconsole.dir(a);\nnode.warn(a);\n\nmsg.payload = a;\n\nreturn msg;",
        "outputs": 1,
        "noerr": 0,
        "initialize": "",
        "finalize": "",
        "x": 280,
        "y": 80,
        "wires": [
            [
                "2bb007b6.a72c78"
            ]
        ]
    },
    {
        "id": "2bb007b6.a72c78",
        "type": "debug",
        "z": "c4be9dd8.3b604",
        "name": "",
        "active": true,
        "tosidebar": true,
        "console": false,
        "tostatus": false,
        "complete": "false",
        "statusVal": "",
        "statusType": "auto",
        "x": 480,
        "y": 80,
        "wires": []
    }
]
`

### What happens?
The main code is in the function node
`const regex1 = RegExp('(?<foo>foo*)', 'g');`
`const str1 = 'table football, foosball';`
`let array1;`

`while ((array1 = regex1.exec(str1)) !== null) {`
`  console.dir(array1);`
`  node.warn(array1);`
`}`

`let a = ["item 0", "item 1", 2];`

`a["myProperty"] = {"prop 0" : "prop 0", "prop 1": "prop 1"};`

`console.dir(a);`
`node.warn(a);`

The result of `exec()` using a RegExp is an array with additional properties (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp/exec#Syntax). Those properties are displayed when you log the array into the console but not when you display it in the Debug Panel (here using `node.warn()`, but the above flows shows that the Debug node doesn't do it correctly either). 

This is confusing.

The same result occurs when you directly add a property to an array like in the second part of the code above.

The correct output is the one given by the console:
`
[ 'foo',
  'foo',
  index: 6,
  input: 'table football, foosball',
  groups: { foo: 'foo' } ]
`
`
[ 'foo',
  'foo',
  index: 16,
  input: 'table football, foosball',
  groups: { foo: 'foo' } ]
`
`
[ 'item 0',
  'item 1',
  2,
  myProperty: { 'prop 0': 'prop 0', 'prop 1': 'prop 1' } ]
`

### What do you expect to happen?
The Debug Panel should display arrays including their properties if any.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: 1.1.0
- [x] Node.js version: 10.11
- [x] npm version: 6.4.1
- [x] Platform/OS: Windows 10 64 bits
- [x] Browser: Google Chrome  v83.0.4103.116

title: OAuth2Strategy: TokenError / InternalOAuthError
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?

We have the following Strategy in place for OAuth / Keycloak authentication with Node-RED (works great in general):
```js
{
  type: 'strategy',
  strategy: {
    name: 'Keycloak',
    label: 'Authenticate with Keycloak',
    icon: 'fa-lock',
    strategy: require('@exlinc/keycloak-passport'),
    options: keycloakStrategyOptions
  },
  users: function (username) {
    return new Promise(function (resolve) {
      var user = { username: username, permissions: '*' }
      resolve(user)
    })
  },
  sessionExpiryTime: 86400
}
```

### What happens?
The following exception was triggered:
```
10 Jun 08:36:28 - [audit] {"event":"auth.login","username":"[redacted]","scope":"*","level":98,"timestamp":1591778188090}
TokenError: Code not valid
    at Strategy.OAuth2Strategy.parseErrorResponse (/app/node_modules/passport-oauth2/lib/strategy.js:358:12)
    at Strategy.OAuth2Strategy._createOAuthError (/app/node_modules/passport-oauth2/lib/strategy.js:405:16)
    at /app/node_modules/passport-oauth2/lib/strategy.js:175:45
    at /app/node_modules/oauth/lib/oauth2.js:191:18
    at passBackControl (/app/node_modules/oauth/lib/oauth2.js:132:9)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/app/node_modules/oauth/lib/oauth2.js:157:7)
    at IncomingMessage.emit (events.js:203:15)
    at IncomingMessage.EventEmitter.emit (domain.js:448:20)
    at endReadableNT (_stream_readable.js:1145:12)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:63:19)
InternalOAuthError: Failed to obtain access token
    at Strategy.OAuth2Strategy._createOAuthError (/app/node_modules/passport-oauth2/lib/strategy.js:408:17)
    at /app/node_modules/passport-oauth2/lib/strategy.js:175:45
    at /app/node_modules/oauth/lib/oauth2.js:191:18
    at passBackControl (/app/node_modules/oauth/lib/oauth2.js:132:9)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/app/node_modules/oauth/lib/oauth2.js:157:7)
    at IncomingMessage.emit (events.js:203:15)
    at IncomingMessage.EventEmitter.emit (domain.js:448:20)
    at endReadableNT (_stream_readable.js:1145:12)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:63:19)
```

Afterwards, Node-RED went down and was no longer reachable for HTTP requests. Restarting the services resolved the issue.

### What do you expect to happen?
OAuth2 errors / exceptions should be handled gracefully. At least Node-RED should not be impacted by authentication issues if possible.

### Please tell us about your environment:
- Node-RED version: `v1.0.4`
- Node.js version: `v10.19.0`
- Platform/OS: `Linux 5.0.0-1035-azure x64 LE`

title: [RFC] Remove the 'Configuration Nodes' sidebar
body:
With 1.1.0 introducing the outliner in the Info sidebar, it occurred to me that the Config Nodes sidebar is much less useful.

The Outliner:
 - includes a 'Global Config node' section
 - lists config nodes that are scoped to individual tabs
 - can be searched and filtered

What it doesn't (currently) have (compared to the Config Node sidebar) is:
 - an indication on how many nodes use the config node
 - an easy way to list out the unused nodes

The first can be easily solved by added the count to the node label - just need to make sure the right editor events are fired whenever that user list may change.

The second could be a filter option - `is:unused` or similar. The deploy prompt saying you have unused config nodes could provide a click-through action to pre-fill that filter in the filter box to show them.

This is just an idea at this point. If we think there is a compelling reason to keep the config node sidebar, then it needs a general overhaul anyway.

I'm raising this issue because I'd like to keep some quick feedback on the idea. If it can be done for 1.1.0 so much the better. Otherwise it can be put on the slate for 1.2.0.

title: [dev] Quick-Add dialog takes too long to appear
body:
Ctrl-Clicking in the workspace opens up the quick-add dialog. Unfortunately, the quick-add dialog is not so quick to appear.

Currently it is building the dialog and the full list of nodes before it displays anything. At a minimum, it would be better to give more instant feedback to the user that something is happening, and *then* populate the list of nodes.

title: update trigger function to support environment variables
body:
update trigger function to support environment variables for both wait and loop functionality

before submitting a pull-request.

## Types of changes

What types of changes does your code introduce?
Put an `x` in the boxes that apply
-->

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

*unsure* if breaking, but I dont think so. I am just a novice user.

<!--
If you want to raise a pull-request with a new feature, or a refactoring
of existing code, it **may well get rejected** if it hasn't been discussed on
the [forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or
[slack team](https://nodered.org/slack) first.

-->

## Proposed changes

<!-- Describe the nature of this change. What problem does it address? -->
This fix introduces a variable "triggerfunction" to hold the chosen function of the trigger node.

This allows the duration variable to solely by used for exactly that the 'duration'. This also allows for the use of environment variables as the duration, for both wait and loop functionality.

Fixes #2528

title: Git merge impossible for big flows.json
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?

Create two git branches for one Node-RED project and try to merge one **big** file flows.json from that different branches. Please note that this is not reproducing if flows.json file is small.

### What happens?

Git does not try to merge files into one, just replacing one file with another.

I even know why that happens. It is because Node-RED save flows.json to git as one string without any formatting: EOL and any other delimiters. Just adding one EOF. I understand, that It is right for Node-RED to save JSON in compact view. But this creates a problem to git compatibility. Could you please provide an option (maybe  managed through settings.js, for example) to save flows.json in formatted view for git?

### What do you expect to happen?

git should see changed lines (like the "diff" tool) from different branches.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [  ] Node-RED version: 1.0.2
Reproduce in any other environment.

body:

<!--
If you want to raise a pull-request with a new feature, or a refactoring
of existing code, it **may well get rejected** if it hasn't been discussed on
the [forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or
[slack team](https://nodered.org/slack) first.

-->

## Proposed changes

Currently when in multi-line modes the the file-in node creates new messages for each line/buffer it outputs... - this doesn't pass though any existing properties of the incoming msg - which is our "normal" behaviour.

This PR fixes that but does mean we clone the original msg for every line/buffer we output...
Questions then are 
 - [ ] is this overhead desirable ?
 - [ ] is there a better way of cloning for this case that may be faster 
 - [ ] is there extra cloning going on on the .send that means we don't need to worry about this here ?

title: Project file settings dialog resets credentialsFile
body:
The Project Settings dialog allows a user to set the name of the flow file. It does *not* let the user the credentials file name. That was intentional to help prevent the user accidentally using the wrong flow/credential file combination.

It is perfectly valid for a user to have set a different credential file name by hand editing the project's package.json file. The runtime handles this properly and uses the identified files.

When you edit the settings of such a project, the Credentials field does not show the customised one - it is set to the name derived from the flow file. If a user edits the flow file name, the credentials file name is reset to match.

### What are the steps to reproduce?

1. create a project
2. hand edit its package.json to point to a different credentials file
3. restart node-red (or open the project)
4. open the project settings dialog - *the wrong creds file is listed*
5. edit the flow file name and hit save - *the creds file is reset to the derived name*

### What do you expect to happen?

1. the creds field should show the true value, not the derived value.
2. allow the user to explicitly set the creds filename - but we do want to retain some of the auto-fill behaviour we have today so they don't *have* to set the creds filename.



### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: 1.0.2

title: localFileSystem context with large objects causes significant thread blocking
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?

1. Populate a big, hierarchical global context object - in my case, it's around 668kb of minified JSON amounting to an object of around 761kb in memory.
2. Set it to persist via `localFileSystem` context storage, with caching enabled and default 30 second flushing.

### What happens?

Node-RED "hiccups" and fails to process any flows for a noticeable period of time dependent upon the underlying machine architecture, causing delays to whatever what happening at the time.

### What do you expect to happen?

Node-RED flow processing should continue smoothly and be unaffected.

This is probably down to the [`json-stringify-safe`](https://github.com/moll/json-stringify-safe) library which isn't the fastest thing on the planet and hasn't been updated in 5 years but which appears to have been selected by the NR team as a way of dealing with circular refs in Node-RED context objects.

_In similar large object situations I've successfully employed a streamed approach with the [`big-json`](https://github.com/DonutEspresso/big-json/) library which doesn't tie things up in this way. Alas it doesn't implicitly do anything about circular refs._

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ ] Node-RED version: 0.20.8
- [ ] Node.js version: 10.16.0
- [ ] npm version: 6.9.0
- [ ] Platform/OS: Azure Web App Service B1 (1 core, 1.75Gb memory)/Docker/Linux (Debian)
- [ ] Browser: Chrome 76.0.3809.132

title: Graceful shutdown
body:
_**Experimental implementation of Graceful Shutdown feature**_ 

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## Proposed changes

Introduce a graceful period in Node-RED shutdown process to prevent interrupting in-progress processes.   Further details are written in [design note](https://github.com/node-red-hitachi/designs/blob/graceful-shutdown/designs/graceful-shutdown/README.md)

###
Current limitations:
- Assuming all nodes uses new Node Messaging API so that runtime can detect in-progress processes.
- In-progress process detection is per-workspace basis.  Because of this, when a flow extends across workspaces, detection algorithm may fail. 

## Checklist

title: WIP: Add an auto-layout action
body:
- [X] New experimental feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## Proposed changes

This is an **experimental** PR to add an auto-layout algorithm to the editor.

This is **not** in the plan for 1.0, but wanted to get this shared now so others can play if they want.

 - it doesn't work very well for anything but a subset of typical flows.
 - it only works on flows with a single input
 - it doesn't work on flows with loops of any sort
 - it uses a fixes offset between nodes and doesn't take into account their actual height/width
 - It works reasonably well for flows that have limited branches and tries to keep the 'main' branch of the flow horizontal
 - the code is not at all optimised, nor documented, and is probably crazy inefficient

To try it out (once you've pulled down the `auto-layout-2` branch:

1. select *one* node in the flow to layout (see restrictions above)
2. trigger the `core:layout-flow` action
3. ...
4. 

To trigger the action you can either:
 - Use Cmd/Ctrl-Shift-P to open the Action palette - search for and trigger `core:layout-flow`.
 - In the JS Console, run `RED.actions.invoke("core:layout-flow")`
 - Open the Keyboard shortcuts dialog and assign a shortcut to it to save typing

title: Connection Problem with TCP-request Node
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?
- Add TCP request Node and connect to device.
-> 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47575973/58865862-9f399900-86b7-11e9-9cbe-e62d58432227.png)

- Disconnect the network at the device
- TCP node remains connected. Socket is not interrupted even though the device is no longer on the network.
- The node does not make a new connection afterwards

-After some unknown time, the socket is rebuilt. even after a deploy or reboot.

- The time defined in settings.js does not seem to work for me. The times are in reality much longer .. Or do they have nothing to do with it?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47575973/58866549-1a4f7f00-86b9-11e9-8c94-b0c9faf0cc79.png)


### What happens?
- The node does not make a new connection afterwards

### What do you expect to happen?
- TCP socket is not closed when no connection

I think, it's something like #1469 ?

title: running from a UNC path fails on flow file write
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?
Run node-red from a folder in a UNC path in PowerShell.
You may need to set an absolute UNC path in flowFile in settings.js.
(I have not tried this with the latest version, but anticipate the bug is still there; see code below)

### What happens?
FlowsFile gets:
8 May 09:14:25 - [info] Flows file     : \\\\DESKTOP-ONGUSK8\Temp\red\local\DESKTOP-ONGUSK8\Temp\red\local\flows.json

Node red cannot save the flow.

### What do you expect to happen?
Flows file     : \\\\DESKTOP-ONGUSK8\Temp\red\local\flows.json

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: 0.17 (modified)
- [x] node.js version: 6.11.2
- [x] npm version: ?
- [x] Platform/OS: Windows 10
- [x] Browser: Chrome

Issue is on line 60 of [runtime/lib/storage/localfilesystem/projects/index.js](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/packages/node_modules/%40node-red/runtime/lib/storage/localfilesystem/projects/index.js)
( in current repo. in 0.17 its in runtime/storage/localfilesystem.js)
```
        if ((flowsFile[0] == "/") || (flowsFile[1] == ":")) {
            // Absolute path
            flowsFullPath = flowsFile;
        }
```
detects the flow file as relative.
Suggest:
```
        if (((flowsFile[0] == "\\") && (flowsFile[1] == "\\")) || (flowsFile[0] == "/") || (flowsFile[1] == ":")) {
            // Absolute path
            flowsFullPath = flowsFile;
        }
```

br,
Simon

title: MQTT node does not reconnect
body:
<!--
This issue tracker is for problems with the Node-RED runtime, the editor or the core nodes.

If your issue is:
  - a general 'how-to' type question,
  - a feature request or suggestion for a change,
  - or problems with 3rd party (`node-red-contrib-`) nodes

please use the [Node-RED Forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or [slack team](https://nodered.org/slack).

You could also consider asking a question on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node-red) and tag it `node-red`.

That way the whole Node-RED user community can help, rather than rely on the core development team.

To help us understand the issue, please fill-in as much of the following information as you can:
-->

### What are the steps to reproduce?
I haven't found a way to reproduce this. Shutting down MQTT broker and restarting it does not reproduce this (the node reconnects within a few 10s of seconds of the broker coming online). 

### What happens?
After a long time of running, like a day or two, the node is found to be disconnected and it remains in that state till the flow is restarted or the node is moved/edited and redeployed.

### What do you expect to happen?
The node should keep trying to reestablish the connection. There should be no limit on how many times or till when attempt to reestablish connection is made.

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [ ] Node-RED version: 0.20.5
- [ ] node.js version: v10.15.3
- [ ] npm version: 6.9.0

title: 0.20 zip release packaging & install documentation
body:
Related to the getting-started/installation documentation, using the release file in the Alternative methods : 
https://nodered.org/docs/getting-started/installation

0.19.x releases were packaged like specified in the documentation. For example, [0.19.6](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/releases/download/0.19.6/node-red-0.19.6.zip) has a single directory at the first level in the zip archive, and everything required by node-red is under the said directory.  

0.20 releases use a different structure, the zip archive currently contains 2 directories :
- node-red
- @node-red

For what I saw, there's no information in the documentation about the @node-red directory.  
After installing only the node-red directory and checking how nodejs/npm managed the modules, it seems the @node-red directory in the zip archive is not at the right place and/or completely skipped due to the `node-red/package.json` .


### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: v0.20.5
- [x] node.js version: v8.15.1
- [x] npm version: 6.4.1
- [x] Platform/OS: Ubuntu 18.04.2
- [x] Browser: Firefox 64.0.2

title: Disambiguate between server listening address and admin URL in startup info, fix #1592
body:
<!--
## Before you hit that Submit button....

Please read our [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
before submitting a pull-request.

## Types of changes

What types of changes does your code introduce?
Put an `x` in the boxes that apply
-->

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

<!--
If you want to raise a pull-request with a new feature, or a refactoring
of existing code, it **may well get rejected** if it hasn't been discussed on
the [forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or
[slack team](https://nodered.org/slack) first.

-->

## Proposed changes

By default, the UI web server is listening on all IPs, but the startup log entry states that it's running on a local address. I presume this was done to let inexperienced users find their way to the admin UI easier.

This may mislead the user that the server is listening only on the loop-back interface and is not accessible from outside, which can become a security issue.

This patch creates separate log entries for the server listening address and for the URL to the admin UI.

<!-- Describe the nature of this change. What problem does it address? -->

## Proposed changes
I created a pull request(draft) for flow testing to run on the CLI.

- Run flow testing.
``
grunt flow-test --testItem="***.json"
``
Flow to be tested is  _flow\<hostname\>.json_ in user directory.

- Command line argument
  - --testItem : Specify the json file for which the test target "test-in node ID" and "Label" are set.
Example:
```
   [
    {
        "id": "a9890736.34f478",  //test-in node ID
        "labels": [
                     "Test Case 01",    // label of test cases
                     "Test Case 02"
        ]
    }
   ]
 ```

When executing this command,target nodes are disable.
(Target nodes are substituted by a test-in/out node.)
But the target node is active immediately after starting node-red in the current implementation.
In order to disable the target node from the start, we are considering improvement methods.

title: Calls in different way to metric method from Node.prototype.send
body:
Hi,

I have a custom package that are thought for enabling the logging of different data per each node. The idea is to be able to write in the log the value of certain data depending on each node (https://github.com/atellezr/node-red-contrib-log4nr/)

This package at the end uses a custom logger and checks the metric events produced, and when an event related to the _send_ or _receive_ occurs, it shows the data in the log, since it arrives the _msg_ object and I can get the required data from it

When I was developing the package I test it successfully with different types of nodes and so, but I did it only with nodes with 1 wire and 1 output. My bad.

And now, it has been seen (https://github.com/atellezr/node-red-contrib-log4nr/issues/3) that when there are more than 1 wire per output

Analyzing the problem, I've seen that the problem I have is due to the fact that the ``Node.prototype.send`` calls the _metric_ method with the _msg_ object when there's only 1 wire (https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/0.19.5/red/runtime/nodes/Node.js#L133) and with the message ID only when there's more than 1 wire (https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/0.19.5/red/runtime/nodes/Node.js#L194), producing that in these cases, my package is quite useless (for the _send_ point of view)

I see that you call the metric in this case even if you have several different outputs, and maybe that's the behavior you want to have, but I'm opening this issue just in case you could consider to move the _metric_ call to the loop (initiated in https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/0.19.5/red/runtime/nodes/Node.js#L159) since it could make sense to inform that a message has been sent from that node, and not only that the node sent a message


### What are the steps to reproduce?

Install my package (node-red-contrib-log4nr), and configure a _http in_ node with 2 wires from the output, and calls that service

### What happens?

Error produced:
```
21 Jan 12:43:22 - [warn] [http in:b96a95f5.abd5f8] TypeError: Cannot read property 'originalUrl' of undefined
```

### What do you expect to happen?

That attribute is part of the _req_ object. If the complete _msg_ is sent to the _metric_ method, it would shows that value in the log

### Please tell us about your environment:

- [x] Node-RED version: v0.19.5
- [x] node.js version: v8.9.4
- [x] npm version: v5.6.0
- [x] Platform/OS: Windows 7
- [x] Browser: Chrome 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Thanks!
Regards.

title: Make contributions easier
body: ## Proposed changes This PR simplifies contributions and playing around with the node-red code base, by adding support for Gitpod a free online dev environment for GitHub. I configured it so that on start it automatically runs ``` npm install npm run build npm start ``` Also port 1880 is exposed and the website will be opened in a preview (see below). This could be configured so you get a notification and can decide whether to open it in a preview or in a new browser tab. The latter might make more sense in the case of node-red. You can use Gitpod for code reviews as well. Just go to a PR and prefix the URL with 'https://gitpod.io/#'. A workspace with the PR changes will be started and open in a code review mode (you can comment and submit reviews within in the IDE) To get an idea of how it feels, please try this snapshot: [![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io#snapshot/435df204-9457-4181-a84a-198d6277d230) ## Checklist - [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x] For non-bugfix PRs, I have discussed this change on the mailing list/slack team. see https://discourse.nodered.org/t/supporting-online-dev-environment/6781

body:

before submitting a pull-request.

## Types of changes

What types of changes does your code introduce?
Put an `x` in the boxes that apply
-->

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

<!--
If you want to raise a pull-request with a new feature, or a refactoring
of existing code, it **may well get rejected** if it hasn't been discussed on
the [forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or
[slack team](https://nodered.org/slack) first.

-->

## Proposed changes

This PR Adds an allow list and Block list to the file in and out nodes so they can be constrained somewhat more than they are. Currently any file in node could read any permitted file in the OS - including things like keys files, the settings.js file (with creds in) etc... 

This PR uses the micromatch library to match files against an allowed match pattern and then a denied pattern. Default is to allow all - but block the userDir/settings.js file only (as this has the patterns for allow and block in - so if they could be overwritten then they could be change to allow all...

title: Add explicit checkbox when configuring MQTT over web sockets.
body:
## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## Proposed changes

It appears that explicit UI support for MQTT over Web Sockets was intended, as some dead code already exists.  This code adds a checkbox on the MQTT configuration screen following the same pattern as for "use TLS".  If unchecked, current behavior stays the same.  If checked, MQTT requests default to use ws:// instead of mqtt:// for the run-time connection to the queue.

The workaround today is to include the URL scheme in the server field.
https://discourse.nodered.org/t/mqtt-broken-url-and-port/1275

I am holding off on creating unit tests for MQTT node, since there is no coverage at all at this time.  If people agree this is a good idea, I'll create tests for the full node.

## Checklist

title: Catch readonly write errors more cleanly
body:
Fail more cleanly when run from a readonly files system without setting readOnly true.

the [forum](https://discourse.nodered.org) or
[slack team](https://nodered.org/slack) first.

-->

## Proposed changes

Currently we crash if run from a 100% read only file system as the settings and config files cannot be moved and written. We should at least inform the user this is happening and exit nicely.

 - 2 the backup file can't be written on deploy

title: Detect & Prevent/Resolve Duplicate Module Definition
body:
The surface issue here is a bug in node-red-contrib-postgres-listen redefining an existing node name, but the underlying issue I'm submitting here is a lack of error checking / conflict resolution capability in the framework itself to handle this.  I'm sure this sort of issue will become more prevalent as node-red increases in popularity.

### What are the steps to reproduce?
Install node-red-contrib-postgres and then node-red-contrib-postgres-listen

### What happens?
The latter node redefines the "postgresdb" config node.  The module is now not functional (shows up in pallette with an error icon and "[object Object]" as a result, and cannot be directly uninstalled without deleting all instances of the original and unrelated postgresdb node.

node-red detects this condition and warns on startup .. but does nothing to resolve it.

At this point I'm apparently unable to remove the broken postgres-listen node without also deleting everything postgres related in my existing flows . . . 

After some experimentation I found a workaround that's apparently 'fixed' the listen-node, and given me the option to uninstall it if I need to.  I had to manually go into the .node-red directory and comment out any section defining the duplicate postgresdb object.  For the pglisten.html file, I actually had to delete the section -- apparently commenting it out with HTML <!-- --> comments doesn't work (another bug perhaps?)  I'll cross post this to the postgres-listen tracker.

### What do you expect to happen?
When installing new modules through the Pallette Manager, node-red should detect any conflicts and prevent installation of a node that redefines one that is already registered.  

Alternatively, perhaps a more stringent naming scheme should be phased in for future releases.  Perhaps something akin to the Java style of packageName.class syntax for maintaining a consistent global namespace among user-contributed modules.

### Please tell us about your environment:
Raspbian

- [ ] Node-RED version: 0.18.7 (as reported in browser)
- [ ] node.js version: 9.4.0
- [ ] npm version: 5.7.1
- [ ] Platform/OS: Raspbian 9.4
- [ ] Browser: Chrome

Andy

title: editableList "items" method returns frankenobject
body:
The `items` method of the `editableList` jQuery plugin returns a jQuery object containing DOM nodes; however, the object's contents cannot be traversed.  For example, if each item (a `HTMLDivElement`) contains a `HTMLInputElement`, this doesn't work as you'd expect:

```js
$('#container').editableList('items')
  .find('input'); // empty JQ object
```

To access these elements, a consumer of the API must do something like:

```js
$('#container').editableList('items')
  .each(function() {
    $(this).find('input') // works
  });
```

That's painful, sure.

The [documentation](https://nodered.org/docs/api/ui/editableList/#methods-items) hints at this issue by noting that the method returns an `Array`.

Unfortunately, it's not *just* an `Array`.  If a consumer wishes to use e.g., `Array.prototype.map` to gather the `HTMLInputElement` values:

```js
// should be Array of strings
$('#container').editableList('items')
  .map(domNode => $(domNode).find('input').val());
```

...the consumer is SOL, because jQuery has its own `map` method *which always returns a jQuery object*.  Instead of an `Array` of `string`s, the result of `map()` above is *always* an empty jQuery object.

Ideally, the value returned by `items` would be a traversable JQ object.  This *should* not be a breaking fix, because any code attempting to use the traversal methods is likely also broken.

References: https://github.com/node-red/node-red.github.io/pull/79

title: All WebSockets fail to connect with "Invalid frame header" after any deploy. Only node-red restart fixes.
body:
### What are the steps to reproduce?

1. Create web socket nodes.
2. User browser to connect (e.g. http://websocket.org/echo.html)
3. Websocket seems to work, disconnect and reconnects fine.
4. Move node to enable "Deploy" button.
5. Deploy change.
6. Websocket fails to connect with console error.

I was originally running via a reverse proxy which I assumed was causing this, but I've moved to direct (just on the same LAN) connection to HTTPS/WSS (also same with HTTP/WS) and it's still happening.

From trial and error I learnt that it's fine after restarting node-red but once a deploy has happened it breaks it. I did wonder if this only happened if there was a live connection that got cut off when it deployed but tested that and it still breaks even if you restart, open admin, deploy, then try to connect.

Assume this can't be a common issue as it would be very immediately apparent to other uesrs too!?

### What happens?

**VM150:164 WebSocket connection to 'wss://xxx/yyy' failed: Invalid frame header**

### What do you expect to happen?

It to connect correctly and not display error.

title: use "files" prop of package.json; remove .npmignore
body:
This makes the list of files to be published a *whitelist* instead of a *blacklist* (`.npmignore`).  This is typically a safer option.  Effectively, there will be no change to the list of files which are published.

`README.md`, `LICENSE` and `package.json` are automatically published by npm.

* * *

This is a refactor (if that).  Anecdotally, I've found the `files` prop of `package.json` to be safer than just relying on `.npmignore`.  This may very well be a "best practice," but I have no references.

In a nutshell, the implications are that of changing any hypothetical permission from "deny" to "allow". 

I didn't feel like anyone would feel strongly about this change (or at least any more strongly than I do), so I did not raise it on the mailing list.

title: Provide a 'local' context, available to this node only
body:
Can now access the node's local context in:
* change node -- added 'local.' pulldown option to src/dest fields
* jsonata expression -- get variable using $localContext() function

## Before you hit that Submit button....

Please read our [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
before submitting a pull-request.

## Types of changes

What types of changes does your code introduce?
_Put an `x` in the boxes that apply_

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

If you want to raise a pull-request with a new feature, or a refactoring
of existing code, it **may well get rejected** if it hasn't been discussed on
the [mailing list](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/node-red) or
[slack team](https://nodered.org/slack) first.


## Proposed changes

In order to use the Change node as a toggle (for instance), the previous value received needs to be saved to local context (only available to this change node). This new feature provides a `local.` pulldown option (similar to `flow.` and `global.`) to set/get a named variable.

The local context variables also can be retrieved in JSONata expression, using a new `$flowContext(name)` function. Again, similar to the `$flowContext(name)` and `$globalContext(name)` functions, but without the potential for conflicting variable names.

## Checklist
_Put an `x` in the boxes that apply_

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [x] For non-bugfix PRs, I have discussed this change on the mailing list/slack team.

- [x] I have added suitable unit tests to cover the new/changed functionality

title: improvements to programmatic flows API - addflow/removeflow
body:
This issue is a location to hold suggestions for improvements to the programmatic flows interface, and will result eventually in a PR.

Currently, RED.nodes.addFlow/updateFlow does not support .disabled, and RED.nodes.enableFlow/disableFlow are not implemented.

Suggested improvements which could be considered:
addFlow to accept .disabled.
addFlow to accept multiple flows in one hit.
removeFlow to accept multiple flows in one hit.
updateFlow to accept multiple flows in one hit, and support .disabled
implement enableFlow/disableFlow.

Other improvements to consider?

title: Websocket In "Connect to" fails with 404 when not passing origin header
body:
Some websocket servers require the origin header to be sent, or else a 404 is returned and the node remains "Disconnected". The origin header is normally set by the webbrowser. This behaviour can be validated by altering line 22 in 22-websocket.js as follows: 

`var socket = new ws(node.path, {origin: "localhost"});`

Before passing the origin option to ws the connection would return a 404. Making this modification allows the node to connect successfully. Can be verified with the application otmonitor, available at http://otgw.tclcode.com/download.html

Suggestion: Please provide an option to pass the origin header when using the Connect to option

title: msg.req cannot be cloned if moved to another property name
Get _session on WebSocket disconnect
body: Seems this issue has come up before and a fix was intended (seen in google group discussion) but it appears there isn't support for this yet. The status node fires on connect and disconnect, but there's no data allowing the event to be associated with the `_session` attribute, and so it seems there's no way to identify which client disconnected.

title: disableWebsockets option - using wrapped sockjs instead
body: Allows node-red to work in environments that do not support websockets, using sockjs.

title: fix "Connection failed ... " during reconnecting
body: Avoid "Connection failed ..." during reconnecting.

title: websocket node anomaly
body:
It says on the info panel for the ws output node: 
If the message arriving at this node started at a WebSocket In node, the message will be sent back to the client that triggered the flow. Otherwise, the message will be broadcast to all connected clients.

That's fine if the ws output has the same path as the input node, but if the message comes in on one ws path and the result of the flow is that a command is sent out to a *different* ws path, then nothing gets sent.

A workaround is to do what we do with flows that start and end with WIOTP nodes and have a 
`msg = {payload: msg.payload};`
function node to clear out the accompanying context.

But I'd rather it worked as expected :)

title: disable Nodes when embedding
body:
I embed Node-Red and would like to disable some core nodes.

# I tried:

```
RED.start().then(function(){
        RED.nodes.disableNode('node-red/tail');
        RED.nodes.disableNode('node-red/file');
        RED.nodes.disableNode('node-red/exec');
        RED.nodes.disableNode('node-red/rpi-gpio');
        RED.nodes.disableNode('node-red/watch');
});
```
# I expected:
Normal application startup with all nodes from the list above disabled.

# What happens instead:
I get a failure message and the nodes are still enabled.
```
Potentially unhandled rejection [1] TypeError: Cannot read property 'flows' of null
    at Object.checkTypeInUse (/tmp/node-red/node_modules/node-red/red/runtime/nodes/flows/index.js:375:15)
    at Object.disableNode (/tmp/node-red/node_modules/node-red/red/runtime/nodes/index.js:94:11)
```

title: Added error logging for websocket node
body:
`websocket` node completely ignores errors here https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/0.16.2/nodes/core/io/22-websocket.js#L64. `ws` library responsibly sends error message as the first argument. You can specify domain which doesn't resolve, or your websocket server can pass some non-parsable bullshit, but everything `node-red` will show you is `disconnected` in UI. No messages in console/web interface.
That's not a mature node, w/o error handling it's just a raw draft. Fixed in PR.

title: How about using tools like jsLint to get better code quality?
body:
While reviewing some parts of the code, I've noticed that there many different writings or maybe formatting mistakes in the code. Sometimes it's a real mess.

There are many tools to get better code quality. How about to use one and create a fixed set or requirements once?

Some examples, found in just one file '_nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js_': 

- Used different quotes:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L20-L21

- Sometimes spaces between operators, sometimes not, sometimes both:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L133-L135

- Using `===` or `==` ?
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L135

- Sometimes no space between _function_ and brackets, sometimes spaces:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L150
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L166

- Sometimes spaces between parameters, sometimes don't:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L237
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L259

- Space between properties and value, or not:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L313-L314

- Or even worse:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L337

- How to write an if?!
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L333
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L336

- Bracket madness:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L376
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L382

- Unwanted spaces:
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/io/10-mqtt.js#L386

And this is just what I saw in this one file. You can imagine how the whole code may look like. Tools like jsLint could help to improve the overall quality of node-red.

title: MQTT nodes shows configuration error even when it's working / CA Certificate configuration failed
body:
I have an `MQTT` broker running with `mosquitto`. This server only allows connection from publishers and subsrcibers by a username/password **and** a CA certificate. This is all set up and running correctly!

When using the cli tools you would connect to the broker somehow like this:

> mosquitto_sub -p 8883 -u USER -P PASS **--cafile /etc/mosquitto/ca.crt** -t 'topic/#'

Now I wanted to use it this way in node-red too. In general no problem. I added the CA file under `mqtt node > mqtt-broker config > tls-config` and added the path `/etc/mosquitto/ca.crt` into the field `Certificate`. 

After deploy this settings everything workes fine, `node-red` can now publish to the broker. But the node, incoming as well as outgoing, show an configuration error (_tiny little triangle on top_). The node sill want to have the field `Private Key` to be filled up too. But this is wrong. There is no key file needed in this setup.

Because of this, every time deploying a warning comes up, saying `The workspace contains some nodes that are not properly configured`, what's not true ...

title: array of paths as settings.nodesDir not documented (almost)
body:
Since 0b8e8de260145d309514b74faa765f1273deacfd (Node-RED 0.7.0 at least, April 2014!) an array of paths can be used for the value of settings.nodesDir, which is very handy if for example you want to build a Node-RED-based framework and need to separate the project/client-specific nodes from the framework ones (and cannot use $userDir/nodes for that), or also want to override stock Node-RED nodes.

Unfortunately this is (almost) not documented anywhere I could find (done a GitHub search and a Google site:nodered.org search for "nodesDir", emphasis mine):
- neither in https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/settings.js: "The following property can be used to specify **an** additional directory to scan"
- nor in https://nodered.org/docs/configuration: "**a** directory to search for additional installed nodes"
- only https://nodered.org/docs/creating-nodes/first-node mentions that "[your own node's .js and .html] files can be located within either the nodes directory in your user directory, typically ~/.node-red/nodes, or **one of the directories** defined in the nodesDir setting", although the syntax is not documented (it could be a (semi)colon-separated-string Ã  la PATH)

Depending on where one starts learning Node-RED one gets different and contradictory information. I found about this feature only by chance by looking at the source code while debugging the loading of my custom nodes...

title: suggestion: provide loading indicator
body:
My use case:

I need to provide a list of devices to the user within a configuration node.  The user will choose a device from the list.  The list is populated with devices after a `GET` request back to the Express runtime; this happens initially during `oneditprepare`.

From here, the user may wish to do two things:

1.  **Refresh** the list of devices; repeat the aforementioned request.  Importantly, this request will receive a response from Express in a fixed amount of time (~2000ms).
2.  **Identify** a device.  This is a bit like identifying computer monitors: you have multiple displays and are attempting to configure them, but you don't know which is which. The selected device will then "alert" the user.  This operation also takes a fixed amount of time.

Both of these operations are triggered by buttons, and would benefit from a (non-modal) "loading indicator" UI element.  I'm thinking of this type of thing in particular: [Ladda](http://lab.hakim.se/ladda/).  Ladda ships w/ a jQuery plugin, FWIW.

Are there other places in Node-Red's UI that'd benefit from an indicator like this?  Would you have any interest in integrating this type of capability into the "common" ui elements?

title: Using nodesExcludes of settings to filter nodes of non-local module
body: Sometimes we have to override existed node type with `nodesExcludes` for specific purpose. This requirement is not only for local nodes but non-local nodes.

title: MQTT: Node Red Client Remains Online
body:
I've tested this with Node Red 15.2 connected to ActiveMQ Broker. 

The issue is the the status of the MQTT out node stays in the "connected mode" for a long time even when disconnected from the broker. To disconnect from the broker I'm disabling the broker's NIC. The node red client shows the "connected status" for ~16 minutes before it changes to disconnected state and then connecting state.

If you re-deploy the project it instantly shows the correct state.

As well, if you reset the broker or shutdown the broker (with the NIC enabled) the status changes instantaneously on the node-red client.

I would expect that the client would be able to determine the connection status with better resolution. 16 minutes is too long for most applications.

Note: The keep-alive timer is 15 seconds.  If I disable the node-red NIC, the Broker does send the LWT in 23 seconds as per the spec.

title: Provide a way to programmatically save Credentials nodes (OAUTH)
body:
When a node uses OAuth to authenticate, it is likely that the AccessToken that is initially retrieved would expire in some period of time. Thus in the code you need to catch the return from an invalid token and issue the Refresh; after refreshing you need to update the Credentials in order to account for the new AccessToken and the next RefreshToken.
Since Node-Red only dumps the Credentials upon the use of the "DEPLOY" button, there is no way for the code in the node to make sure that the refreshed credentials are properly dumped. Thus as soon as Node-Red needs to restart, it is likely that a previously used set of credentials will be read, thus invalidating the node itself.

What I propose is to add a Method that "forces" the dump of the credentials, thus simulating a manual "DEPLOY".

title: Editor should allow port/wire denial
HttpIn node causes MongodbOut node (and, possibly, others) to fail
body:
Hi,

**Summary**
From what I could gather, the HttpIn node wraps the request (req) and the response (res) objects in the message (msg) that it sends further down the flow ([function where this happens](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/129ca0e39fb7d63dc68b575f36fdf24782b225c4/nodes/core/io/21-httpin.js#L185)). The resulting msg object is stuck with circular references (since req references res and vice versa).
As a consequence, when some other node tries to serialize the msg object, it fails.

**What I did to reproduce the problem**
- Cloned the node-red repository.
- npm install
- npm install node-red-node-mongodb
- grunt build
- node red.js
- created a flow that looks like this:

![flow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12189877/14134631/50116a54-f661-11e5-9f80-2adccade6993.PNG)

here's the CTRL+E result (I replaced the mongo server info):

``` json
[{"id":"34488c05.7f22ec","type":"mongodb","z":"22fbfb3c.fa39b4","hostname":"my.mongo.server","port":"27017","db":"my_database","name":"My Mongo"},{"id":"b35bd775.0fcf48","type":"http in","z":"22fbfb3c.fa39b4","name":"HTTP_IN","url":"/test","method":"post","swaggerDoc":"","x":70,"y":126.5,"wires":[["9ea5bf22.c8447","f0d03ec8.6832c8","c3fd7806.65e47"]]},{"id":"9ea5bf22.c8447","type":"debug","z":"22fbfb3c.fa39b4","name":"","active":true,"console":"false","complete":"true","x":258,"y":20,"wires":[]},{"id":"f0d03ec8.6832c8","type":"http response","z":"22fbfb3c.fa39b4","name":"HTTP_RES","x":282,"y":126,"wires":[]},{"id":"c3fd7806.65e47","type":"mongodb out","z":"22fbfb3c.fa39b4","mongodb":"34488c05.7f22ec","name":"My Mongo","collection":"my_collection","payonly":false,"upsert":false,"multi":false,"operation":"store","x":274,"y":243.5,"wires":[]}]
```

When I send a POST request to http://localhost:1880/test with a simple json content, the debug tab shows this information:

![debug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12189877/14135138/63688aee-f664-11e5-845d-c00f3807f147.PNG)

and the node console looks like this:

```
Welcome to Node-RED
===================

30 Mar 10:42:36 - [info] Node-RED version: v0.13.4-git
30 Mar 10:42:36 - [info] Node.js  version: v5.9.0
30 Mar 10:42:36 - [info] Windows_NT 10.0.10586 x64 LE
30 Mar 10:42:36 - [info] Loading palette nodes
{ [Error: Cannot find module '../build/Release/bson'] code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND' }
js-bson: Failed to load c++ bson extension, using pure JS version
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [warn] ------------------------------------------
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [warn] Failed to register 2 node types
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [warn] Run with -v for details
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [warn] ------------------------------------------
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [info] Settings file  : C:\Users\User\Documents\GitHub\node-red\settings.js
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [info] User directory : C:\Users\User\Documents\GitHub\node-red\userDir
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [info] Flows file : C:\Users\User\Documents\GitHub\node-red\userDir\flows_CompName.json
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [info] Starting flows
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [info] Started flows
30 Mar 10:42:41 - [info] Server now running at http://127.0.0.1:1880/
30 Mar 10:42:56 - [error] [mongodb out:My Mongo] RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
```

Needless to say, if I check the "Only store msg.payload object" option in the MongodbOut node the error doesn't occur anymore.

To test if other nodes could be affected by this issue, I modified the flow to include a simple function node that would use the msg object returned by the HttpIn node:

![function](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12189877/14135329/92367812-f665-11e5-89d6-b9c11b889767.PNG)

and the console says:

```
30 Mar 10:50:58 - [error] [function:return JSON.stringify(msg);] TypeError: Converting circular structure to JSON
```

I'm planning to test this issue with other nodes that could be used to handle http input. I will return with updates.

Thank you!

title: "Cannot GET / " issue on httpAdminRoot
body:

title: Support for proper display of bidirectional text (Arabic / Hebrew)
body:
This is a first of several feature requests associated with languages with bidirectional scripts such as Arabic / Hebrew / Farsi / Urdu etc. 
In this specific issue we discuss proper display of plain text with natural text direction (LTR for English, RTL for Arabic / Hebrew). 
Background information, suggested design and glimpses into implementation are provided in PDF file attached hereafter. Once we finalize the design my team can submit a pull request with full implementation. 
[NodeRED_BTD_BidiSDD0_29February2016.pdf](https://github.com/node-red/node-red/files/151270/NodeRED_BTD_BidiSDD0_29February2016.pdf)
