title: starting/stopping node RED engine multiple times causes "Invalid frame header" error in google chrome console
Support for OAuth
body: A number of folks have been requesting OAuth support through the forum.  The HTTP node currently has support for basic auth but there is no solution for OAuth without developing a node (ie - the Twitter node).  I hope this is the right place to be opening this request.

title: CSV node should still populate a rows keys, even if the column is empty
body:
For example, if you are importing a CSV of the form

```
FirstHeading, SecondHeading, ThirdHeading
first, second, third
first,,third
```

The output should be

```
[
    {
        "FirstHeading": "first",
        "SecondHeading":"second",
        "ThirdHeading":"third"
    },
    {
        "FirstHeading": "first",
        "SecondHeading":"",
        "ThirdHeading":"third"
    }
]
```

rather than

```
[
    {
        "FirstHeading": "first",
        "SecondHeading":"second",
        "ThirdHeading":"third"
    },
    {
        "FirstHeading": "first",
        "ThirdHeading":"third"
    }
]
```

A simple fix (I think) for this would be changing this line (and the line below it):
https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/nodes/core/parsers/70-CSV.js#L111

title: Need API exposure of flow status
body:
I have created a wrapper for Node-Red that can spawn many instances running on consecutive ports and proxied through the parent process. Each child instance can be stopped and started without being destroyed. What I need is a way to see if a particular instance is flowing or not flowing. Something like this:
If you take instruction from website Documentation for "Embedding into an existing app" the Red object  has functions start() and stop(). It needs a status() function. This function could expose the property from Red.server.redNodes.flows.activeFlow.started

title: HTTPS Memory and CPU Issue
body:
I discovered a bug with memory and CPU usage when Node-RED is using HTTPS.

Here is the original thread:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/node-red/q6P6fTgYWR0/i7cZHa2EVWAJ

Environment:
ARMv5
 v0.10.38 or v0.8.28 of NodeJS
Node-RED v0.10.4
Linux kernel 3.12.27

Here is the flow file:
[{"id":"f37069bc.0c8f98","type":"debug","name":"debug-output","active":true,"console":"true","complete":"true","x":760.2000122070312,"y":222.00001525878906,"z":"4e726af0.b18d94","wires":[]},{"id":"ba391381.45c6f","type":"http in","name":"","url":"/test","method":"get","x":304.2000274658203,"y":259.0000305175781,"z":"4e726af0.b18d94","wires":[["f37069bc.0c8f98"]]}]

Here is the curl command which causes the memory leak/CPU bug:
curl -k https://192.168.2.1:1880/test?bar=foo

Once curl is run, the memory on the system is rapidly consumed and the processor is maxed out.  Eventually, Node-RED crashes if it is given less than 128MB of memory to start with.  Otherwise, it can run for tens of minutes with high CPU and memory usage with >128MB memory.

title: Singleton subflows
body:
Currently, a subflow represents a template of nodes. Each instance of the subflow added to the workspace represents a discrete instance of that subflow.

This issue covers adding the concepty of a Singleton subflow (which needs a better name before we ship it). Each instance of such a subflow added to the workspace points to the same concrete instance of that subflow.

For such a subflow, the node-status and node-action elements can be re-enabled (which are currently disabled when editing a subflow template).

The choice of whether it is a singleton or not will either be via a checkbox in the subflow toolbar, or in the current "edit name" dialog.

title: Add features to avoid performing node scan on startup
body:
The main contributor to our slow startup time is the scan we perform looking for node files and modules.

On slower hardware, such as the Raspberry Pi, this can add 10's of seconds to the time.

From 0.9, we began storing a list of discovered nodes in the `.config.json` file. This tells us what was there the last time we ran.

It should be possible to use this list to reload what was loaded previously and avoid doing the full scan each time.
- The user would have to run once with scanning enabled to create the file. Then they can run with it disabled.
- If node-red-cli is used to add/remove nodes, the file is already automatically updated
- If nodes in the file are not found, they are removed (unless existing auto-reinstall option is set)
- if nodes are manually npm installed, or copied in place, the user would have to rerun with scanning enabled to pick them up.

This opens up the possibility of precaching/compressing node html files into a single file that can be served straight from disc and not loaded in memory each time.

---
- [x] adds path information for the individual nodes in `.config.json`
- [ ] add option (settings.js and command-line) to disable node scan
- [ ] add admin api for triggering a rescan and add to node-red-cli

title: Allow node modules to have node modules as dependencies
body:
Node-red scans for `node_modules` directories starting from its install location and working up the tree to the root path. When it finds such a directory, it examines the `package.json` files of the modules in the directories immediately below; it doesn't scan deeper for additional `node_module` directories.

This means a node module cannot declare another node module as a dependency and have it load properly - which is a reasonable thing to allow.
- when a valid node-red node module is discovered, scan its `node_modules` directory
- ensure we are recording the version number of node modules
- if a node module is found that we have already loaded:
  - if the version number matches, skip it and carry on.
  - if the version numbers don't match, refuse to load it (and if this was in a node module's node_module directory, refuse to load the top level module as its dependency cannot be satisfied)

title: Enabling systemd socket activation
body:
To reduce startup resource consumption on platforms like BeagleBone Black, it would be good if node-red were patched to use the node-systemd library, if it is installed. This means attempting to perform the require and adjusting the call to 'listen' to take only a single argument.

https://gist.github.com/jadonk/ad049193593539cea29e

title: Fix for node import when imported node is missing required parameters
body:
This issue happens when imported node is missing some parameters which are required in the new node. In such case, existing parameters should be imported and missing parameters should be set to defaults.

The issue is caused, because the check for node._def.defaults.hasOwnProperty(d2) is pointless, as d2 is already a value from the defaults iteration and the code to copy the default values was missing.

This sorts out the import of nodes via local file system, clipboard and library.

title: Outbound TCP sessions
body: Our TCP nodes don't make it easy to do outbound TCP sessions. The work done under issue #65 solved it for inbound, but not outbound.

title: Feature Request: create API for registering menu items
body:
Please create a client side API to allow node types to register menu items. The menu items are indented to implement features that apply to all nodes of a specific type.

See also my email to the mailing list about the 'Schedule View':
https://groups.google.com/d/msg/node-red/T3fSNYcNMKY/ZYfpQmsDRwwJ

The implementation should take into account any future mobile or tablet UI.
